Authors:
Achala Roshani Rathnayaka, Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe,
Monika Chandani Dayarathne, Thilini Chethana, Chang-Hsin Kuo, Peter E
Mortimer, Kevin D. Hyde
Title:
Hyaloterminalis, a novel genus of Coryneaceae (Diaporthales)
from Taiwan
Keywords:
1 new species, asexual, phylogeny, taxonomy,
Sordariomycetes
Abstract:
The new generic and species name Hyaloterminalis
alishanensis is introduced for the dematiaceous coelomycete in
Coryneaceae isolated from the dead branches of Cerasus sp. in Alishan,
Taiwan. Coryneum was the only genus in Coryneaceae and Hyaloterminalis
has similar morphological character to Coryneum by broadly fusiform
brown conidia. However, Hyaloterminalis differs from species of Coryneum
by pycnidial conidiomata, paraphyses, nature of the conidiophores, long
narrow hyaline tip of the apical cell and hyaline basal cells. Multigene
phylogenetic analyses, using partial sequences from the 28S nrRNA gene
(LSU), internal transcribed spacer regions and intervening 5.8S nrRNA
gene (ITS) of the nrDNA operon and the translation elongation factor
1-alpha region (TEF) generated from maximum likelihood, maximum
parsimony and MrBayes analyses, demonstrated Hyaloterminalis
alishanensis that forms a distinct lineage within the family Coryneaceae
and its establishment as a new genus is supported. The new taxon is
compared with genus Coryneum and descriptions, illustrations, appraisal
on taxonomy for the taxa are provided.
